Q: What significant achievement did Dr. Kan Hatakeyama accomplish in 2033?
A: In 2033, Dr. Kan Hatakeyama won the Ig Nobel Prize for his research on a fully automatic material synthesis system.

Q: What did the AI develop when Dr. Hatakeyama asked it to mass-produce a new AI?
A: The AI, using chemical synthesis robots, created a novel compound called PolyAI.

Q: What is unique about the structure of PolyAI?
A: PolyAI has a geometric structure that resembles the letters "AI", and it consists of 1-(2,5-dimethylhex-3-yn-1-yl)-2-methylcycloprop-1-ene as its repeating unit.

Q: How are the unit structures of PolyAI connected?
A: The unit structures of PolyAI are connected by ether bonds.

Q: How did the AI solve the limitation of the Williamson ether synthesis reaction?
A: The AI discovered a revolutionary synthesis route using a phosphorus-based catalyst, achieving an addition rate of over 99.5% and high molecular weight.
